title: (4730-263) Lanhas - 4 Rua Augusto Sousa Antunes
description: Quiet and safe motorhome and poids lours

title: (32869) Quintela -
description: Very nice vantage point at the top of the mountain. Directly on the tarred mountain road, but very quiet (March), hardly any cars. There are many cows walking around here and the landscape is surrounded by rocks. You can walk and wander around here very nicely. I think it can be pretty windy up here. The only downside, the place is right near a big power pole.

title: (4840) - N307
description: Small parking with beautiful views of the lake and mountains, along a road with little traffic. Two flat pitches At 1km from the start of a super hike of 18km and 1200 m of elevation to the Serra Amarela in loop by the ridges and the lake.

name: Camping Quinta de Pentieiros
title: (4990) Camping Quinta de Pentieiros
description:
Camping Quinta de Pentieiros, inside  Lagoas de Bertiandos protected area.
Traditional camping with area for campers, grass parking. There is an educational animal farm, playground and swimming pool. Very family friendly.

title: (4720) Seramil -
description: Nice quiet spot

title: (4720) Paranhos - Rua de Sarnadela
description: Capela de Santo Ovídio

title: (4920) - N303
description: Nice place for a stopover. More beautiful and peaceful than the noisy stops on the road. Barbecue grills and many tables to eat. The parking space offers only a few flat spots. Really great plus just one minute from the highway.

title: (4840-030) Campo do Gerês - 101 Rua Geira
description: Small parking lot to which we were brought by the rangers' feedback.

title: (4730) Lugar da Portela - 504 N101
description: water source. Guted water, doesn't taste like chlorine.

title: (4840) - N307
description: Small parking by the road wihout any service. We spend there only 30minutes but it is no problem to stay overnight.

title: (32870) Lobios - OU-540
description:
A small path along the road which goes down to a nice location where there are 2 picnic tables.

A more than pleasant view of the lake and the small surrounding mountains.

The road is not far but is very lightly used at night. Even with a very light sleep you should not be disturbed.

No trash cans, so please take your trash away.

Little sun, located in the shade of the fir trees.

title: (4840) Braga - N307
description: Small parking lot with picnic tables. Still under construction, but wonderful view !!

title: (4970-150) - 215 En 202
description:
Official parking for the monastery of Peneda. Great place to visit, also many hiking trails depart here. Water, toilets, cafe and a restaurant can be found here. Not recommended for overnight-it is in a village also there are loud bells of the church next to it. 
Drive from the northern side of the village.

title: (32870) Lobios - OU-540
description: Beautiful spot for a van alongside a abandoned road by the water. Follow the asphalt road next to the (amazing) ”Restaurante A Madalena”. No traffic. Very quiet. In the morning one fisherman came by. Caution: the road is wearing off so not recommended for big motorhomes. Perfect for a van. Shop and restaurant nearby.

name: Parque Cerdeira
title: (4840-030) Parque Cerdeira
description:
Good área with all of conditions 
very quiet and very good

title: () - EM533
description: Parking in the heart of Geres Park. Water point available.

title: (4970-150) Gavieira - 233 En 202
description: A nice place behind the church with a beautiful view of the valley. It can be busy during the day but wonderfully quiet at night. Nowhere is it indicated that you are not allowed to park here at night and in the low season (April) there was no check. A few level pitches on top, many more on a slope. Toilet building next to the church, however, it seemed that it was not cleaned. Perfect starting point for beautiful hikes.

title: (4920) Sapardos - 801 N303
description: Just a break by the side of the road. Wide ground which allows to stop for lunch with a beautiful view.

title: (4730) - 101 Avenida do Autarca
description: Near school. Very calm, large and safe park.

title: (4950) - EM1120
description:
Nice place with a lot of space
next to the beach Praia do Sr do Rio 
cold shower, piknik tables and barbecues.
great calm place for people with childrens

title: (4730) - 236 Avenida Professor Machado Vilela
description: Large place with shelter. Very safe and quiet. Near police and fire department.

title: (4970) - Unnamed Road
description: Accessible parking area a little higher than the road. No shade. Mountain view. Just above the village. Very good for one night. Possible for any size.

title: (4970) Arcos de Valdevez - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in a quiet, relatively flat, a small km from the village center. Good alternative to that of the center. Empty out of season even during the day (May). Surely no longer used during the day in high season when the village is full. Perfect for sleeping, no ban. Departure of hike. Sorry no pictures. On your right when you go down towards the village. There is a similar one 100m further.

title: (4720) Paredes Secas - 66 EM535-2
description: Leave the place with a beautiful view surrounded by mountains. it is safe because it is close to homes, but not so close that it is uncomfortable for you or the neighborhood. you have fresh water 50 meters in the church or in the cemetery. It also has a Roman road called Geira.

title: (4910) Arga de Cima - Unnamed Road
description: Magnificent view Picnic tables start of hikes very very quiet

title: (4920) Candemil - N303
description: Picnic spot on side of road. Could sleep the night. Water and bins available.

title: (4990) Ecovia - Ecovia
description: Snack park

name: Camping Covas Park
title: () Camping Covas Park
description: Muito bom, um típico parque de campismo bem cuidado. O pessoal foi extremamente simpático 5 estrelas.

title: (4920) Covas - Zona de Lazer de Covas
title_short: (4920) Covas - Zona de Lazer de Covas
description:
Pic nic area with parking, in the nature. Super beautiful and calm!
There are picnic tables and benches, a barbecue area, with sink. The toilets were closed, but the building seems quite new.
It's right at the Coura river where you can go for a shallow swim, super idilic.
Beware of the access, because the path is a bit steep and bumpy, and right at the curve. We have a 6m motorhome, and it worked for us.

title: (32870) Lobios - OU-540
description: View of the lake and parking possible for around twenty motorhomes. Little shade but quiet

title: (4720) - EM1248
description: Parking lot of the Abadia monastery. a large car park before arriving (where we parked for the night - a little sloping) and a small, higher, flat and shaded parking lot. WC nearby and water fountain. Very nice quiet site.

title: (4720) Rendufe - 947 EM567
description: Below the road right next to the bridge, riverside, but a lot of car traffic.We stayed there, no problem.ok for camping car.No service.

title: (4930) Monte do Faro - 6 N101-1
description: Site next to picnic area. There is a fountain near the lookout. We didn't stay overnight, we just parked to see the views. It seems calm.

title: (4930) - Unnamed Road
description: St Ovidio viewpoint

title: (4910) Arga de Baixo -
description: Large parking lot with picnic tables. It is next to a road but not very busy. It is the parking lot to access the climbing sector. There are no services, no garbage can, so it is our responsibility to take our garbage :)

title: (4730-596) Turiz -
description: Water point we were able to fill our cans no precision if the water is drinkable

title: (4950) Mazedo - Parking Igreja
description:
Huge and empty car park by the church, asphalted and inclined. Beautiful views on the foggy mountains in the morning. Quiet at night, church bells in the morning. Little shade, toilets and water behind the church. 

2km from Monçao, which was too noisy for us on a Friday night.

title: (4950-096) - EM1112-2
description: Lovelylittle restaurante by the road nice service good food

name: Camping Quinta da Viña Grande
title: (32869) Camping Quinta da Viña Grande
description: Camping at the quinta da Viña Grande. Small, very pleasant campsite with about twenty shaded pitches. A charming welcome. Very clean sanitary facilities with hot water. Pitches Suitable for vans but a little tight for motorhomes.

title: (32870) Aceredo - OU-540
description: Parking, no ban on mobile homes, with a view of the village of Aceredo, which was flooded 30 years ago. We stand here with our camper for one night. Right on the street, quiet at night.

title: () Lobios - OR-312
description: Free parking lot just after/beforoe the nationa park. During the day it could be full, the night it is empty...perfect for the night. There is a recycle bin, pleas use it!

title: (4720) - 9 Rua de Santa Maria
description: Parking area (flat) with tables, drinking water, bins and bbq. Separated from the main road although there is still some road noise. Still a peaceful spot with lots of fruit trees and a small park area attached. 100m from the monastery and local bar.

title: (32870) Lobios - OU-1207
description: Parking for a camper, access to the lake, no service.

title: (4720) Braga - 204 Rua de Terreiro
description: A simple and free parking lot, near mosteiro de Santa Maria do bouro, and close the restaurant “O cruzeiro” famous for “Papas de sarrabulho” (a must in Minhota region), there’s also a playground, bakery and butcher nearby. It’s allowed to park at night but there might be some traffic noise.

title: (4830) Verim - Unnamed Road
description: Snack toilet shower bathing possibility of spending the night on a slightly sloping parking, access only in van or van

title: (4920) - Unnamed Road
description: Very quiet place on the mountain surrounded by nothing but nature. Beautiful view. Very quiet and secluded. Not suitable for large motorhomes. 4x4 an advantage, but we got along well with our 2wd T4.

title: (4845-075) Vilar da Veiga -
description: Small flat site slightly set back from the road. Magnificent view and few passages on the road at night.

title: (4845) Terras de Bouro - N308-1
description: Cove next to the road with great views. Surprisingly flat. There were a few cars passing by at night, but it is not a busy street. We stayed there 1 night. Alternative to the car park in the center of Geres, but walks do not leave directly from here.

title: (4730) Escariz (São Martinho) - 7 EM540
description: Parking place at the foot of a beautiful church. Very calm. No church bells between 10 p.m. and 7 p.m.

name: Vidoeiro Geres Camping
title: (4845) Vidoeiro Geres Camping
description: Campsite in the middle of nature. Beautiful with the river that flows there. Even possibility to immerse. There is room for campers, vans and tents. All facilities available.

title: (4730) - 534 N101
description: Large park, no problem staying overnight

title: (4950) Lapela - Rua do Rio Minho
description: Nice place to spend a night or two. Right next to the Minho River and Torre de Lapela. This is a picnic area with tables, restrooms, barbecues and water nearby. Try not to reach the place through the village as the curves are short and could damage your motorhome. There is a road around the village which also leads to this picnic spot! In the village you will find a café and a supermarket.

title: (32895) Lobios - OR-312
description:
Nice place to stay for one night. There's  a table and a small stream coming down the valley. The road isn't too busy at night. 
There's also a footpath leading up to the border and continues from there to the waterfalls and the lake.

title: (4845) - Estrada Florestal
description:
Simple parking space to sleep a night. There are only 3 simple parking spaces. If you look for a place to stay longer this is probably not a valid option. 

But it is very quiet in the night (main season), you are on the middle of the nature and you hear a lot of animals. 
Also the hiking path GR50 starts at the parking lot. Maybe during the day hikers are coming.

title: (4950) Monção - 152 EN202
description: drinking water fountain. Water is controlled and suitable for consumption. Access and exit excellent. No faucet or thread. Therefore only with bucket and watering can.

title: (4920) - Unnamed Road
description: Natural pitch on top of the hill, ocean views and absolute peace, an excellent place to spend time in complete solitude

title: (4960) Cousso -
description: Flat area with beautiful views. Two picnic tables. Space for 4 vehicles. Very calm.

title: (4845-075) - 131 Rua Tude de Sousa
description: Free parking day and night without service. Visit the spa town 3 minutes, very quiet at night.

title: (4845) - Estrada Florestal
description: At the soccer field there are a few possibilities to stand with larger or smaller vehicles, either at the parking lot (a bit uneven) or on the path in front of it (2 very good spots, on the picture). It is half way up the slope. It was very quiet, almost no one came by, I recommend it Especially for vans. Starting point for GR hikes.

title: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
title_short: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
description: Next to the Lanheses Dock, this lovely riverside spot is a gem to park your motorhome for a day or a night. Access is also easy with larger mobile homes. The dock has its own paved car park, however these are too narrow and preferred by the locals, so use the gravel/grass space on the left (max 3 RVs). Lots of people walk and bike during the day, but it's quiet at night. Picnic tables, hiking trails, green river landscape. At the end of the playground on the left, in the direction of the village, there is an outhouse.

title: (4845) Caldas de Gerez - N308-1
description: Shaded picnic area with many stone and wooden tables. Attention difficult to park, winding road and cobblestones.

title: (4845-075) Vilar da Veiga - Unnamed Road
description:
Viewpoint over the national park and the valley with picnic tables.
We only stayed there to eat but I think it is possible to stay the night there out of season.
The road passes right next to it but there is very little traffic

title: (4845-075) Gerês - 40 Rua Arnaçó
description: Parking at the top of the town of Geres just above the cemetery and at the edge of the road. places with more or less slope. the seats are very large.

title: (4845) - Unnamed Road
description:
Attention: national park!
it is therefore forbidden to park/overnight here.

Nice view next to the water reservoir below a quiet road. We spent a very comfortable night there to make a small fire. 300 m passable route, possible in an equipped van, impossible in a motorhome!

title: (4845-028) Rio Caldo - 99 N304
description: Small drinking water tap on the side of the road. Parking space nearby. Only to fill a few cans. Don't think about hooking up your hose. ..

title: (4845) - N308-1
description: Nice parking just 1km from Vila do Geres centre.

title: (4845-028) Braga -
description: Semi-flat place, very little slope, with capacity for about 3 large vehicles. Parking next to the river, with a beach area for swimming. Quiet night listening to the river water. Access by paved road, to the car park. Complicated access for vehicles over 8m and 4 meters high, but at night with little traffic it can be practicable. During the day it is a bathing place for some residents, they usually park on the same road.

title: (4720-071) Ferreiros - 1 Rua Augusto José Machado
description: Safe and secure premises

title: (4720) Lago - Unnamed Road
description: Around the remains of an old mill is this river beach equipped with numerous tables for picnics. Very shady place and with the possibility of taking a bath in the river that flows calmly. Parking for 15 small vehicles. Possibility of large AC but not at peak times, on holidays crowds of locals come. Flat ground. quiet night

title: (4845) -
description: Very nice spot to spend the night, without any problem more advice for off-road cars

title: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
title_short: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
description: Spacy unpaved area right next to the river Lima, the ground wavy but you should be able to position your vehicle evenly. Some thirty metres away there are houses, but it doesn't feel like parking in their garden. You can take some steps into the river, but beware if its strong current! There's a boat landing, but only some three or four boats lie there. Traffic noises are audible in the distance. Of course some people, also youngsters, pass by and enjoy the place. All in all, for me it was a quite agreeable mixture of private and taking notice of civilisation. The access road is unproblematic for medium-sized vehicles, except for the last meters that are quite bumpy so you better go pretty slow there.

title: (4845) Rio Caldo - Unnamed Road
description: It’s a bulky road but my corsa got through the spot is located directly at the road but only the fire brigade used the road at night you can have a refreshing bath in the sea. You’ll find a lot of those places at this road just drive along till you find your spot

title: (32870) Aceredo -
description: Currently the once submergwd town of Antiga Aldeia Aceredo is accessible and offers some amazing, albeit morbid views. access is by a somewhat steep dirt road, so 4x4 highly recommended. several places to park, some flat, some with an incline.

title: (4950) Monção - 8 EM1097-1
description: Huge parking lot, no prohibition signs. Quiet nights! There is a water tap, but without thread. Highly recommended! Please note: every Thursday there is a market in this parking lot. So DO NOT park between Thursday 05:00 am and Thursday 18:00 pm

title: (4845-028) Braga - n 45 Rua 1
description: Motorhome area. We were in mid-September and we were alone, a quiet place near the town of Río Caldo.
